1.text: Now in the Church that was at Antioch, there were some prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was surnamed Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

2.text: As they were liturgizing to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”

3.text: Then, after fasting and praying, they laid their hands on Barnabas and Saul and sent them on their way.

4.text: Being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia and from there sailed to Cyprus.

5.text: When they were at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues, with John as their attendant.

6.text: After going through the island to Paphos, they met a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar Jesus.

7.text: He was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus. Being an intelligent man, the proconsul called Barnabas and Saul in order to hear the word of God.

8.text: However, Elymas the sorcerer (this is his name when translated) opposed them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.

9.text: But filled with the Holy Spirit, Saul (who is also called Paul), fixed his eyes on Elymas

10.text: and said, “You are full of all [kinds of] deceit and cunning, you son of the devil and enemy of all righteousness! Will you not stop perverting the right ways of the Lord?

11.text: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is against you! You will be blind, unable to see the sun for a season!” At once, mist and darkness fell upon Elymas, and he began to grope around, seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

12.text: When the proconsul saw what had taken place, he believed and was amazed by the teaching of the Lord.

13.text: Now Paul and his company set sail from Paphos to Perga in Pamphylia where John left them to return to Jerusalem.

14.text: Continuing from Perga, they came to Antioch of Pisidia. There, they went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down [to listen].

15.text: After the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent them a message, “Brethren, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, speak!”

16.text: So Paul stood up, motioned with his hand, and said, “Men of Israel and you [Gentiles] who fear God, listen!

17.text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and made the people prosper when they lived as aliens in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm, he led them out of it.

18.text: For a period of about forty years, he put up with them in the wilderness.

19.text: And after destroying seven nations in the land of Canaan, God distributed their land among them by lot.

20.text: After this, for about four hundred fifty years, he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

21.text: Then they asked for a king, and God gave to them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin [who ruled] for forty years.

22.text: After removing him, God raised up David to be their king, even bearing witness to him, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who will do all my will.’

23.text: From this man’s seed, God has brought salvation to Israel, according to his promise.

24.text: This was before the coming of Jesus, when John first preached the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

25.text: As John was completing his work, he said, ‘Who do you suppose that I am? I am not he! But behold, one comes after me whose sandals I am unworthy to untie.’

26.text: Brethren, children of the line of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, this message of salvation has been sent to you!

27.text: Indeed, those who live in Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize him or the voices of the prophets which are read every Sabbath. Still, by condemning him, they fulfilled the prophets!

28.text: Although they could find no cause for his execution, they asked Pilate to have Jesus killed.

29.text: After fulfilling all the things that were written about him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a tomb.

30.text: But God raised him from the dead,

31.text: and he was seen for many days by those who had come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. They are his witnesses to the people.

32.text: And now, we bring you the Good News that the promise made to the fathers has come about:

33.text: God has fulfilled it for us, their children, by raising up Jesus. As it is also written in the second psalm:  You are my Son.   Today I have become your father.

34.text: That God raised him up from the dead to never again return to corruption, he has declared in these words: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’

35.text: Therefore, he also says in another psalm, ‘You will not allow your holy one to see decay.’

36.text: Then, after having in his own generation served God’s purpose, David fell asleep. He was laid with his fathers and saw decay.

37.text: But he whom God raised up did not see decay!

38.text: Therefore, may you know, brethren, that through this man the remission of sins is proclaimed to you!

39.text: By him, everyone who believes is justified from all things, things from which you could not be justified by the law of Moses.

40.text: Beware therefore, for fear that what is spoken in the prophets may come on you:

41.text: Behold, you scoffers, be amazed, and perish!   For in your days, I [shall] accomplish a work,   which you will not believe, even if one would proclaim it to you.

42.text: And so, as the Jews were leaving the synagogue, the Gentiles begged that these words might be preached to them the next Sabbath.

43.text: Now when the congregation was dismissed, many Jews and devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and encouraged them to persevere in the grace of God.

44.text: The next Sabbath, almost the entire city was gathered to hear the word of God!

45.text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy and opposed what Paul said, contradicting and blaspheming.

46.text: Then Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, saying, “It was necessary that God’s word should be spoken to you first. But since you are rejecting it and consider yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles!

47.text: For this is what the Lord has commanded us, saying:  I have set you as a light for the Gentiles,   So that you should bring salvation   to the uttermost parts of the earth.”

48.text: When the Gentiles heard this, they rejoiced and received the word of the Lord, and as many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

49.text: Thus, the word of the Lord was spread throughout the entire region.

50.text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women as well as the leading men of the city. They instigated a persecution against Paul and Barnabas and expelled them from their borders.

51.text: So the apostles shook off the dust of their feet against these people and went to Iconium.

52.text: And the disciples were filled with joy and [with] the Holy Spirit.
